summary: A letter from attorney Jennifer Freeman and Dr. Joyanna Silberg to U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, providing detailed information from a client ('I') alleging childhood sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell at Epstein's NYC mansion in 1997. The letter includes descriptions of abuse, corroborating details about the mansion, and references to child sexual abuse imagery allegedly sent to the victim as threats.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.context: Attorney with the Marsh Law Firm who authored the letter to U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss, providing information about her client's abuse allegations against Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Joyanna Silberg
persons.role: Clinical psychologist and expert on childhood sexual abuse
persons.context: Internationally renowned expert on severe childhood sexual abuse who worked with Jennifer Freeman to collect evidence, analyze information, and turned over child sexual abuse images to law enforcement.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Recipient of the letter, to whom the information about possible childhood sexual abuse by Ghislaine Maxwell is being provided.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Allegedly sexually abused the victim ('I') at his NYC mansion, referred to as 'Jeffrey' by the victim, described with curvy hair and big eyebrows.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Allegedly groomed and sexually abused the victim at Epstein's mansion, described as tall, thin with short dark brown hair, brown eyes, British accent, and referred to as 'Lane' by the victim.

persons.name: Mike
persons.context: Alleged foster father of the victim who, along with 'Sheila', sexually abused and trafficked her. Believed to have known Epstein and sent threatening images to the victim.

persons.name: Sheila
persons.context: Alleged foster mother of the victim, whose real name may be Barbara Levin or Levine. Allegedly sexually abused and trafficked the victim, interacted with Maxwell at parties.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.context: Mentioned as reportedly providing Epstein a birthday gift of 12-year-old triplets, indicating evidence of abuse of younger girls.

persons.name: Mike Fullilove
persons.context: From DeliverFund (associated with HSI) who confirmed Ukrainian phone numbers provided by the victim were linked to her traffickers.

persons.name: Stephen Sauer
persons.context: Listed as a cc recipient on the letter.

persons.name: Noel Engels
persons.context: Listed as a cc recipient on the letter.

connections.description: Allegedly groomed and sexually abused the victim together at Epstein's NYC mansion.
Alleged foster parents who sexually abused and trafficked the victim together.
The victim believes Mike knew Epstein, and Sheila interacted with Maxwell at parties.
The victim saw Sheila interact with Maxwell in a friendly way at parties, indicating they knew each other.
Worked together to collect evidence and information regarding the victim's abuse allegations.
Reportedly provided Epstein a birthday gift of 12-year-old triplets.

events.title: Alleged abuse at Epstein's NYC mansion
events.description: The victim ('I') alleges she was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell at Epstein's mansion at 9 East 71st Street in Manhattan.

events.title: Threatening message sent to victim
events.description: The victim received a message on her phone depicting a mutilated woman with the text 'This is what will happen to you if you talk, so be quiet.' in Hebrew.

events.title: Trafficker attempts to meet victim
events.description: After a trafficker arranged to see the victim via a Ukrainian phone number and didn't show up, the victim received an aggressive message in Hebrew demanding her location.

events.title: Submission of evidence to U.S. Attorney
events.description: Attorney Jennifer Freeman and Dr. Joyanna Silberg compile and send a letter with evidence and allegations to U.S. Attorney Audrey Strauss.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan mansion)
keyFacts: The victim ('I') alleges she was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell at Epstein's NYC mansion at 9 East 71st Street in 1997, when she was a young child.

The victim's detailed description of the mansion's exterior and interior (6-7 stories, off-white, arched door with gargoyles, specific artwork, turquoise couch) matches known features of Epstein's property.

The victim alleges her foster parents 'Mike' and 'Sheila' (possibly Barbara Levin/Levine) trafficked her to Epstein and others, and that Mike later threatened her with child sexual abuse images to keep her quiet.
Dr. Joyanna Silberg turned over child sexual abuse images to law enforcement, including one depicting a rape on a turquoise couch with a window view consistent with Epstein's mansion.
Phone numbers used by the traffickers were traced to Ukraine, suggesting an international connection to the abuse network.
